text: for two days they were prevented from
crossing now turkey has started allowing
dozens of Syrians into its territory
thousands of refugees from talib yard
have been sleeping out in the open by
the border after their town held by is
militants came under attack by Kurdish
fighters the offensive backed by
airstrikes from the us-led coalition
caused many to flee from the bombings
the Turkish troops stationed at the
crossing were overwhelmed by the sudden
surge of people arriving the Kurds want
control of talabira to expand their
territory the move would also block a
major supply route to the ious
stronghold of rocker the militant groups
rely on it to bring in new foreign
fighters and supplies at least 13,000
people have fled into Turkey this month
escaping the intense fighting in
northern Syria the state-run news agency
said that least two and a half thousand
people are still waiting to cross armed
is militants have been seen forcing
displaced families at the border to
return home such was the desperation on
Sunday a large group managed to cut
through a border fence whilst others
through their belongings over and
attempted to pass through the barbed
wire the Kurdish advance has worried
president Erdogan concerned about an
expansion of Kurdish sway in Syria
meanwhile a security source at the
border crossing has said they're
expecting as many as 10,000 people to
come across katarina mo BBC news
